title: Software Engineer
description:
You now have the chance by joining the team at Open Payments as our next Software Engineer.

**About Open Payments:**


Open Payments is a VC-backed fintech founded in 2017, building the infrastructure that brings **Banking Power** to businesses across Europe. Through our open and secure API platform, we unify **Open Banking and ISO in perfect harmony**, giving ERPs and business systems seamless access to bank accounts, payments, and financial data across.


Based in central Stockholm, we’re a dedicated and ambitious team on a mission to reshape how businesses use, move, and manage money. By delivering a modern, unified API, we enable truly **integrated, automated, and effortless** financial access — the foundation for the next era of Embedded Finance.

  

At Open Payments, you’ll take on exciting challenges, work with the latest technologies, and join a passionate and engaged team that’s building something transformative for the financial industry. We offer competitive compensation, health benefits, 30 days of vacation, and the opportunity to help shape the future of Banking Power in Europe.

**What you will do:**


As a Software Engineer, you will be part of a development team responsible for building our API, which we do with modern technologies based on primarily .NET Core/C#, REST APIs, Microsoft Azure, Docker, Kubernetes, and gRPC. You will be involved in everything from working closely with our product team in designing and improving our product, to writing clean and high-quality code, all the way to testing and deployment of the product and features. The role is primarily backend development, but we do build some frontend applications with React.js.


**Who are you?**


We believe that you are eager and curious to take on the task to shape and implement our product in this new space. It’s a broad role, so we also see that you are both flexible and good at taking own initiatives and responsibilities.


We also see that you have **3+ years of experience** with:


* Working as a backend developer or a fullstack developer
* .NET Core, C# and REST APIs

**It’s a plus if you have experience with:**  



* Building integrations
* DevOps
* Microsoft Azure, Kubernetes, Docker, Grpc
* React.js or other JavaScript frameworks
* Detecting and resolving issues in software functionality (you don’t need to be a traditional tester, but someone who enjoys spotting and fixing problems)
* Agile frameworks
* The Open Banking industry

 **Benefits**:


* Competitive salary in a growing startup
* 30 days holiday
* Health benefits
* Office in central Stockholm

**Sounds interesting?**
  

If you have any questions, you're welcome to contact Joakim Lindborgat joakim.lindborg@openpayments.io

  

We look forward to your application!

title: Gruppchef till enheten för äldre och funktionsnedsättning
description:
**Är du en engagerad ledare som drivs av att stärka och motivera dina medarbetare? Tycker du om att arbeta för en rättssäker handläggning och att driva verksamheten framåt i en omvärld som är i ständig förändring? Då behöver vi dig! Vi söker nu en gruppchef som har en blick för helheten och individens behov och förutsättningar. Välkommen till oss!**
 Nynäshamn är en lagom stor plats för hela livet. Här jobbar vi tätt tillsammans för att ge invånarna professionell service, samtidigt som du själv också får möjlighet att påverka och utvecklas. När arbetsdagen är slut väntar en annan verklighet - med havet, skogarna och naturen in på knuten.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Som gruppchef arbetar du närmast biståndshandläggarna för äldre och funktionsnedsättning och stöttar dem direkt i det dagliga arbetet. Du ger stöd till medarbetarna både enskilt och i grupp genom prioriteringar, handledning och coachning i vardagen och bidrar till en god arbetsmiljö genom att skapa förutsättningar som främjar arbetsglädje och hälsa. Du ansvarar för ärendedragningar och är beslutsfattare enligt Socialnämndens delegationsordning. Du säkerställer att myndighetsutövning sker i enlighet med gällande lagstiftning och praxis, Nynäshamns kommuns värdegrund och styrdokument, övriga författningar och kvalitetskrav.
   

  

 Du bistår enhetschef i att systematiskt och kontinuerligt planera, följa upp och utvärdera enhetens verksamhet samt bidrar med förslag till utveckling och eventuella åtgärder. I tjänsten ingår ett visst personalansvar som rekrytering och introduktion av medarbetare, hålla medarbetar- och lönesamtal samt att hantera enskilda personalärenden i samråd med enhetschef.
   

  

 Tillsammans med dina kollegor på avdelningen tar du ett helhetsansvar för invånare i behov av stöd i Nynäshamns kommun. Du samarbetar och samverkar med andra parter både internt och externt för att ge invånare ett samordnat stöd. Du samarbetar nära din gruppchefskollega för LSS/socialpsykiatri och när denna är frånvarande kliver du in i dennes ställe. Därför är det meriterande om du har erfarenhet av myndighetsutövning inom LSS och socialpsykiatri.
   

  

 Om arbetsplatsen
   

  

 Socialförvaltningens huvuduppdrag är att erbjuda individanpassat stöd och service inom äldreomsorg, funktionsnedsättning, barn och familj, vuxen samt ekonomiskt bistånd. Vi finns på plats för kommuninvånarna genom livets alla skeden. Socialförvaltningen har genomfört en organisationsförändring under 2025 för att bättre möta intentionerna i den nya socialtjänstlagen där all myndighetsutövning samlats inom områdena individ- och familjeomsorg, äldre och funktionsnedsättning och en gemensam mottagning har skapats. Samtidigt skapades även avdelning socialt stöd där öppenvård, främjande och förebyggande insatser samlats.
   

  

 Enheten för äldre och funktionsnedsättning ansvarar för handläggning av ansökningar om insatser enligt Socialtjänstlagen (SoL) och Lagen om stöd och service till vissa funktionshindrade (LSS). Målgruppen är både äldre och yngre personer som, på grund av fysisk eller psykisk funktionsnedsättning, har behov av stöd och hjälp i sin vardag. På enheten arbetar biståndshandläggare, boendesamordnare och metodstödjare. Totalt består enheten av 25 medarbetare och leds av en enhetschef tillsammans med två gruppchefer: en för biståndshandläggare inom äldre och funktionsnedsättning och en för LSS och socialpsykiatri.
   

  

 Den grupp du kommer att ansvara för - äldre och funktionsnedsättning, består av 13 biståndshandläggare.
   

  

 Det här söker vi hos dig
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du:**
* socionomexamen
* minst fem års erfarenhet av biståndshandläggning inom målgruppen äldre
* kunskap om IBIC
* goda kunskaper i socialtjänstlagen, förvaltningslagen och annan relevant lagstiftning
* goda kunskaper i svenska språket - både i tal och skrift
* god datorvana och förmåga att snabbt ta till sig nya IT-system


**Det är meriterande om du har:**
* chefserfarenhet inom myndighetsutövning
* erfarenhet av myndighetsutövning inom LSS och socialpsykiatri
* kunskaper i verksamhetssystemet LifeCare


**Personliga egenskaper vi letar efter**
 Som person är du strukturerad, tydlig och stabil och du skapar engagemang och delaktighet för att få med dig medarbetare mot gemensamma mål. I stressade situationer kan du bibehålla struktur, värdera komplex information, göra korrekta prioriteringar och fokusera på rätt saker.
   

  

 Som ledare är du stabil och coachande, naturligt kommunikativ och tydlig i din ledarroll. Du förstår innebörden av att vara ett gott föredöme och ser till verksamhetens bästa. Du anpassar din ledarstil efter person och situation på ett smidigt och lyhört sätt samtidigt som du konstruktivt kan utmana, ta tag i svåra situationer och fatta nödvändiga beslut. Du leder utifrån en helhetssyn och har en god samarbetsförmåga.
   

  

 Det här erbjuder vi dig
   

  

* Hos oss får du göra skillnad i människors liv. Här har du nära till din chef och dina kollegor, påverkan och beslut.
* Nynäshamn är en lugn och trygg kommun. Tryggheten finns även i våra team – vi är prestigelösa, uppmuntrar och backar upp varandra när det behövs.
* Nynäshamns kommun är en del av Sveriges starkaste tillväxtregion. Vår resa ger dig möjlighet till utmaningar och varierande arbetsuppgifter.
* Vi erbjuder fri tillgång till gym. Du får även friskvårdstimme eller friskvårdsbidrag.
* Du har möjlighet till semester- och pensionsväxling.
* Vi har en aktiv personalförening där du kan hyra stugor i fjällen och i skärgården. Du kan också delta i olika aktiviteter som till exempel padel, kajak och ridning.
* Här har vi flextid och kortare arbetstid under sommaren. Det finns också möjlighet till distansarbete.


 Vår rekryteringsprocess
   

  

 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och använder en kompetensbaserad rekryteringsmetod för en rättvis och objektiv bedömning. Mångfald är en tillgång, och vi välkomnar alla sökande. Vissa tjänster kan kräva utdrag ur belastningsregistret.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan och hoppas att du vill bli en del av vårt team!
   

  

 Information om tjänsten
   

  

 Tillträde: enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning
   

  

 Sysselsättningsgrad: Heltid
   

  

 Antal lediga befattningar: 1
   

  

 Ref. nr: SON/2025/0366/022

title: Onsite Technician
description:
**Om uppdraget** 




 Som Onsite-tekniker ansvarar du för att leverera högkvalitativ support på plats. Du hanterar allt från installation och leverans av datorer och klientnära hårdvara till att lösa problem där fjärrstyrning inte räcker. Du kommer även att dokumentera ärenden i kunskapsdatabas och ärendehanteringssystem samt bistå vid driftstörningar och säkerhetsincidenter.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 



* Säkerställa hög leveranskvalitet inom lokal Onsite Support.
* Hantera VIP-ärenden med snabb och kompetent hjälp.
* Installera och leverera datorer och annan IT-hårdvara samt uppdatera hårdvaruregister.
* Dokumentera ärenden och lösningar i system.
* Supportera skrivare och konferensrum.
* Samarbeta vid större driftstörningar och säkerhetsrelaterade incidenter.



  





**Vi söker dig som** 



* Har relevant erfarenhet av IT-support och ett starkt teknikintresse.
* Är serviceinriktad, kundorienterad och trivs med att hjälpa kollegor.
* Har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
* Är van vid dokumentation och administrativ hantering av IT-ärenden.
* Har B-körkort.
* Är flexibel, proaktiv och har förmåga att prioritera i en föränderlig miljö.
* Är en lagspelare som gärna delar kunskap och kommer med förbättringsförslag.



  





**Meriterande** 



* Erfarenhet av arbete i en stor koncern med komplexa IT-miljöer.



  





**Övrigt** 



* Tjänsten kräver godkänd säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen.
* Befattningen kan medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.
* **Plats:** 
 Järfälla/Solna.
* **Omfattning:** 
 Heltid.
* **Start:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse.



  





**Vill du bli en del av ett team som gör skillnad varje dag?** 
 Skicka in din ansökan med CV redan idag!
 



  





**Kontakt** 




 För frågor om uppdraget, kontakta ansvarig Business Manager, Joanna Nyström, joanna.nystrom@akkodisgroup.com
 



  





**Om Akkodis** 




 På Akkodis är du som konsult vår högsta prioritet. Vi stöttar dig i din karriärutveckling och erbjuder uppdrag i olika branscher, system och miljöer. Du omfattas av kollektivavtal, försäkringar, friskvårdsbidrag och rabatter på träningskort. Vi ordnar regelbundet sociala aktiviteter och arbetar tillsammans för att skapa framtidens lösningar inom IT och Engineering.
 



  





 Varm välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Data Engineer to Non-Retail Credit Risk | SEB, Stockholm
description:
We are looking for a Data Engineer to join the Non-Retail Credit Risk modelling team in SEB. The job offers an exciting mix of analytical challenges and professional development opportunities: building modern, scalable data pipelines and reports understanding and abiding to regulatory constraints and explaining complex models to stakeholders on all levels across the Bank. You will be part of a dedicated expert team with broad exposure across the bank and excellent prospects for personal and career growth.
   

  

 Since SEB was founded in 1856, our focus on customers and long-term relationships has been at the heart of our success. We aim to drive positive change by providing capital to help everyone reach their goals and accelerate progress towards a sustainable tomorrow. As a leading financial services group in northern Europe, we'll help you grow and empower you to take on more responsibility to create a real difference. Welcome to SEB.
   

  

**About The Role**
 The Non-Retail Credit Risk modelling team is in the CRO organization in SEB. Credit Risk covers IRB, IFRS9 and stress testing models across all jurisdictions and legal entities of SEB Group. As a data engineer in the Non-Retail Credit Risk modelling team, you will be central in the work to establish a new data platform catering to credit risk modelling and regulatory reporting.
   

  

**The position covers a broad range of credit risk quantitative analysis including:**
* Designing, implementing, and maintaining modern, scalable data pipelines to support credit risk modelling and reporting
* Building and maintaining ETL frameworks that ensure transparency, reproducibility, and regulatory compliance
* Upholding and improving a data quality control framework, representing credit risk quantification in group functions involved in data quality
* Identifying data deficiencies and designing solutions to address such deficiencies
* Interaction with control functions and IT development. Specification of IT development requirements
* Documentation and regulatory interaction
* Responsibilities and tasks within the role of a data steward


 The role is based in Stockholm.
   

  

**To Succeed In This Role, We Believe That You**
* Have a true interest in building modern, scalable data infrastructure with a clear data lineage and driving automation through CI/CD
* Like to get things done and can translate challenges into concrete options on what to do next
* Enjoy detective work and take pride in building a top-quality data layer
* Are a team player and can work closely and collaborate with external stakeholders from different parts of the bank
* Can prioritize and are committed to deliver high quality on time – also under time pressure
* Are honest, reliable and willing to speak up even when it is difficult


**Your Experience And Background**
* Degree: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
* Version control and CI/CD (e.g. Git, GitLab/GitHub)
* ETL pipeline development
* Knowledge of SAS, SQL and Python
* Knowledge in data warehouse methodology is an advantage
* Knowledge in data modelling is an advantage
* Knowledge in data visualization (Tableau, Visual Analytics, Power BI, etc.) is an advantage
* Knowledge in credit risk modelling (e.g., PD, LGD and EAD) is an advantage
* Knowledge in credit risk related legislation and supervisory guidelines (e.g., CRR and CRD) is an advantage
* Cloud platforms (e.g. Azure, AWS, GCP) is an advantage
* Strong communication skills in English, both spoken and written; knowledge of Swedish is an advantage


 Candidates for both junior and senior roles are encouraged to apply.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Friendly and welcoming culture
* Challenging and interesting projects at the forefront of credit risk modelling
* A supportive environment for learning, development and career progression
* Attractive compensation and benefits.


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 18th of January. If you have questions about the position, please contact Bujar Huskaj, Head of Non-Retail Credit Risk modelling team, by mail bujar.huskaj@seb.se, but we will not process applications via email. Please note that the recruitment process may take a bit longer due to the holiday season. We will get back to you as soon as possible.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career

title: Quantitative Analyst I Stockholm, SEB
description:
We are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join the Non-Retail Credit Risk Modelling (NRCRM) team in SEB. The job offers an exciting mix of analytical challenges and professional development opportunities: developing credit risk models, understanding and abiding to regulatory constraints and explaining complex models to stakeholders on all levels across the bank.
   

  

 Since SEB was founded in 1856, our focus on customers and long-term relationships has been at the heart of our success. We aim to drive positive change by providing capital to help everyone reach their goals and accelerate progress towards a sustainable tomorrow. As a leading financial services group in northern Europe, we'll help you grow and empower you to take on more responsibility to create a real difference. Welcome to SEB.
   

  

**About The Role**
 You will be part of a dedicated, expert team with broad exposure across the bank and excellent prospects for personal and career growth. NRCRM is part of the CRO organisation in SEB. Credit Risk covers IRB, IFRS9, and stress testing models across all jurisdictions and legal entities of SEB Group. As a Quantitative Analyst in the NRCRM team, you will be developing and maintaining IRB models that lie at the core of SEB’s risk management and capital framework.
   

  

**As a Quantitative Analyst, You Will**
* Conduct data collection, analysis, and model parameterization
* Develop, enhance and maintain models to support credit decisions, capital adequacy and pricing strategies
* Document model assumptions, accuracy, and data requirements
* Participate in regulatory and internal model development projects, collaborating with experienced quants and credit risk experts
* Develop strong relationships with stakeholders, such as presentinganalysis and results to internal stakeholders in risk, business and credit functions
* Help ensure models are used effectively by supporting their implementation in production and contributing to documentation and governance processes


 You will have the opportunity to develop a deep understanding of quantitative risk modelling in banking, while continuously building your technical and professional skills in a supportive and intellectually stimulating environment.
   

  

 The role is based in Stockholm.
   

  

 Who you are
   

  

**To Succeed In This Role, We Believe That You**
* Have a genuine curiosity for data, modelling and credit risk
* Are structured and solutions-oriented, with a mindset focused on continuous improvement
* Enjoy quantitative problem-solving and are comfortable working with data
* Are a team player, who thrives in a collaborative environment, values knowledge sharing and contributes to a positive working environment
* Communicate clearly and can convey technical topics to various stakeholders
* Are responsible, reliable and willing to speak up and challenge when needed


**Your Experience And Background**
* A Master’s degree within a quantitative field, including but not limited to Statistics, Mathematics, Finance, Economics and/or Engineering
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Hands-on experience working with data, analysis and modelling
* Proficiency in Programming – especially Python, SAS and SQL is an advantage
* Knowledge in credit risk modelling (e.g., PD, LGD and EAD) is an advantage
* Understanding of credit risk related legislation and supervisory guidelines (e.g., CRR and CRD) is an advantage
* Strong communication skills in English, both spoken and written; knowledge of Swedish is an advantage


 Candidates for both junior and senior roles are encouraged to apply.
   

  

 Do you want to be part of SEB?
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 18th of January. If you have questions about the position, please contact Bujar Huskaj, Head of Non-Retail Credit Risk modelling team, by email bujar.huskaj@seb.se, but we will not process applications via email.
   

  

 Please note that the recruitment process may take a bit longer due to the holiday season. We will get back to you as soon as possible.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.https://sebgroup.com/careerhttps://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Associate Operations Manager - Strategy & Operations
description:
Wolt is a Helsinki-based technology company that provides an online platform for consumers, merchants and couriers. It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions – as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Wolt Market brand. Wolt’s products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants) and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Wolt’s mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 29 countries today, 25 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.
   

  

  





**So, why work at Wolt?**




 At Wolt, we’re about getting things done.
   

  

  





 You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.
   

  

  





 We work hard to make cities into better places, and it’s pretty cool seeing us grow every week. If you’re passionate about building things that just… work, Wolt might be for you.
   

  

  





**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**
  

  

  

 We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.
   

  

  





***Join us today to build Wolt together.***




  

  

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 Join a forward-leaning and agilent team at Wolt as an Associate Operations Manager in region North!
   

  

  





 As an Associate Operations Manager in the Regional Strategy & Operations team, you will be responsible for driving innovation, implementation and execution across all aspects of our operations. This particular role will have a major focus on leading our ambitions to make autonomous deliveries a natural part of our operations across the region. It will also include working with other key areas and challenging problems while spearheading the innovation for new ideas; whether it is a new courier partnership model, a new sustainability project or a new delivery mode all together. In this, you will be responsible for bringing structure to ambiguous situations and own the forward progress. You will collaborate across individuals, teams and functions, bringing your natural knack for ownership, execution and problem-solving.
   

  

  





 Reporting directly to the Regional Head of Strategy & Innovation as part of Regional Operations, your role is crucial in achieving ambitious targets in all countries and all business lines that we operate in.
   

  

  





**What you’ll be doing**




 This is a multi-faced and highly varied role, but the major areas of responsibilities including tasks are:
   

  

  




* Own the operational part of autonomous deliveries - incl. vision & strategy, partnership negotiations, feasibility studies, unit economics, product development coordination and scale-up of operations.
* Identify and suggest new business and project opportunities within the scope Strategy & Innovation, based on industry insights and data driven hypotheses
* Utilize your analytical skills to create data driven hypotheses of how to solve complex problems involving all sides of the Wolt platform and business environment.
* Lead and own responsibility areas in focus that you oversee from ideation to implementation and follow-up, with the potential of leading a team in the future
* Effectively collaborate with internal and external stakeholders across all functions of the company to ensure progress for your specific responsibility areas including but not limited to product, marketing, legal, policy, local and global business teams.
* Monitor KPIs and conduct analysis to unpack why performance is what it is and devising strategies to meet or exceed the targets for region North


**Our humble expectations**
* Strong sense of ownership and accountability for end results
* Experience from operational autonomy development and implementation
* Proactive "doer" mentality, with willingness to fail and open to learn from mistakes
* Self-driven and able to fill your own and team members’ work weeks with tasks, based on agreed purposes and end-states for the direction of the team and the company
* Solves problems independently and proactively
* Experienced manager, that has led both big and small projects and teams before with successful, measurable results
* Passionate about new technology and innovative ways to operate
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and Swedish (other Nordic languages is a plus)
* Proficient in digital collaboration tools like GSuite, Slack, and Zoom


**Next Steps**

 We preferably look for a candidate based in Stockholm, to work from our office there but for the perfect candidate other countries in the Nordics, Baltics and Luxemburg can be discussed. If the above sounds like you, or someone you know, please don’t hesitate to reach out. We look forward to your application!
   

  

  





 If you have any further questions about the position before submitting an application, you can turn to:
   

  

 Laura Ilioaea - Talent Acquisition Partner
   

  

 laura.ilioaea@external.wolt.com
   

  

  





 Please note that we do not accept applications coming in via email. Please submit your application in English via our career page.

title: Channel Systems Engineer
description:
**Our Mission**
 At Palo Alto Networks®, we’re united by a shared mission—to protect our digital way of life. We thrive at the intersection of innovation and impact, solving real-world problems with cutting-edge technology and bold thinking. Here, everyone has a voice, and every idea counts. If you’re ready to do the most meaningful work of your career alongside people who are just as passionate as you are, you’re in the right place.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 This role is remote, but distance is no barrier to impact. Our hybrid teams collaborate across geographies to solve big problems, stay close to our customers, and grow together. You will be part of a culture that values trust, accountability, and shared success where your work truly matters.
   

  

**Job Description**
**The Team**
 Our SE team members work hand-in-hand with large organizations around the world to keep their digital environments protected. We educate, inspire,and empower our potential clients in their journey to security.
   

  

 You are empowered with unmatched systems and tools and a team built on joint success. You won’t find someone at Palo Alto Networks that isn’t committed to your success – with everyone pitching in to assist when it comes to solutions selling, learning, and development. Our Systems Engineering community is driven by the mission to be our customers’ cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting their digital way of life.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 As a Channel Systems Engineer covering a regional territory, your role will involve providing leadership, technical expertise, and guidance to partners on their journey towards becoming key Palo Alto Networks partners. You will work as a technical leader with channel partners, providing technical expertise to support the technical sales and implementation of company products and solutions. This role involves collaborating with partners, training them on technical aspects, providing pre-sales technical assistance, and ensuring successful integration and post-sales success.. The Channel Systems Engineer will act as a trusted advisor, driving growth within the region by fostering strong relationships with channel partners and ensuring they have the knowledge and tools needed to succeed. We are working to create partner experts for life.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Serve as the primary technical leader for channel partners within the assigned region
* Collaborate with focus partners in the territory to develop comprehensive business plans that align to strategic objectives
* Provide technical pre-sales support to partners, including product presentations, demonstrations and solution architecture design
* Collaborate with your sales peers to identify opportunities for new partnerships and expand existing ones
* Plan and drive detailed technical training sessions for partners, ensuring they are proficient in the company’s products, solutions, and integration processes
* Support channel partners with technical issues during and after product implementation, acting as a liaison between them and the company's technical support teams
* Applies Business and Technical Acumen to design and deliver customized solutions based on partner and customer needs, ensuring alignment with company standards and best practices
* Stay updated on product roadmaps, new technologies, and industry trends to better assist partners in growing their business
* Assist in the development and deployment of channel enablement materials, such as technical guides, manuals, and webinars
* Collaborate with the product management and development teams to provide feedback on product improvements based on partner and customer feedback
* Drives results by maintaining detailed records of partner interactions, sales pipeline, and technical support provided, reporting progress to management regularly


**Qualifications**
**Preferred Qualifications**
* 6+ years of experience in Partner Solution Consulting, pre-sales engineering, or a similar technical role within the technology industry
* Skilled in at least one of the following Networking, Network Security, Cybersecurity, Private/Public Cloud Security, SOC/Endpoint or SASE
* Prior experience working with channel is required. Strong understanding of channel sales models and experience working with resellers, distributors, and other channel partners
* Previous experience selling, implementing, or managing SaaS offerings is strongly preferred
* Experience in complex sales involving long sales processes with multiple buying centers and multi-product solutions is preferred
* Prior experience architecting cybersecurity solutions that solve technical challenges and influence business initiatives is preferred
* Experience influencing and gaining buy-in from key stakeholders, either in a customer-facing or internal role
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to present complex technical information to non-technical audiences
* Hands-on experience with product installations, configurations, and troubleshooting
* Ability to work independently and as part of a cross-functional team, managing multiple projects in a fast-paced environment
* Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude towards resolving issues
* Willingness to travel within the assigned region to support partners and attend events as necessary
* Proven track record of influencing key stakeholders and gaining buy-in for technical solutions
* Proficient in English and Swedish
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field or equivalent military experience


**Additional Information**
**Our Commitment**
 We’re problem solvers that take risks and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.
   

  

 We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.
   

  

 Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Project Coordinator IT
description:
**We are looking for a Project Coordinator IT for a company in Södertälje. Start is January 12th, 1 year contract to begin with. This role can be carried out 50% remote and 50% onsite in Södertälje.** 




  





  





 The assignment requires an experienced Project Coordinator to support the internal Project Manager with project administration, follow-up of own responsibilities, support the PM with preparation and performance of PI planning sessions together with the IT department, create transparency and communication with all parts of the project, and support with risk management and mitigation plans.
 



 Education in Finance, Business Administration or Engineering with some years of experience in project coordination within Banking/Finance & Accounting in combination with IT.
 



  





  





**Meriting & Skills** 




 Experience in project coordination within banking, finance & accounting in combination with IT. Open-minded, ability to work in an international and diverse as well as fast changing environment, reliable, highly motivated and proactive team-player. Good communication and presentation skill.
 



 This role requires fluency in both English and Swedish.
 



  





  





 This is a full-time consultant position in Södertälje through Incluso. Start is January 12th, 1 year limited contract to begin with, with possibility of extension after that. This role is can be carried out 50% remote and 50% onsite in Södertälje.
 



  





  





 Please submit your CV as soon as possible since we will review the applications on an on-going basis.
 



  





  





 For more information about this role, please contact Marianne Nilsson, recruiter at Incluso.

title: Cloud Administration and Operation
description:
Key Responsibilities
 


* Design, provision, and maintain Azure infrastructure using Terraform (IaC) following best practices for modularity, state management, security, and cost efficiency.
* Build and operate AKS clusters, including lifecycle management, upgrades, scaling, and cost optimization to ensure maximum utilization and adherence to budget constraints. Implement and manage network policy and security using Cilium (eBPF-based) to enforce micro-segmentation and secure pod-to-pod communications.
* Manage multi-cluster Kubernetes environments with diverse workloads (stateless, stateful, batch, and service mesh integrations).
* Install, configure, and operate Argo CD for GitOps-driven continuous delivery across AKS clusters create and maintain application manifests, sync strategies, and RBAC.
* Develop and maintain CICD pipelines, monitoring, logging, and alerting for cluster and application health.
* Continuously analyze cloud usage and propose optimizations for cost control, including right-sizing, reserved instances, scaling strategies, and eliminating wasted resources.
* Troubleshoot production incidents, perform root cause analysis, and implement preventive measures. Collaborate with development, security, and platform teams to define best practices, standards, and automation for cloud native operations. Mentor junior engineers and contribute to documentation, runbooks, and operational playbooks.
* Profile 6-7 years of relevant experience in cloud infrastructure and platform engineering.
* Strong hands-on experience with Azure (AKS, VNet, Load Balancers, Managed Identities, Azure AD, Storage, Networking). Proficient in Terraform for provisioning and managing Azure resources experience with modules, work spaces state backend, and CI integration.
* Practical experience installing, configuring, and operating Argo CD in AKS and managing GitOps workflows for application delivery. Solid knowledge of Kubernetes concepts and operations (deployments, Stateful Sets, Ingress Service, Helm, CRDs).
* Hands-on experience with Cilium network policies and eBPF concepts to secure cluster networking and implement micro-segmentation.
* Experience operating and troubleshooting multi-cluster environments with diverse workloads and namespaces.
* Proven ability to analyze and control cloud costs with a focus on cost-aware architecture and efficient resource utilization.
* Good scripting and automation skills (Bash, Python, or similar) familiarity with CI tools like GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps, Jenkins, or GitLab CI.
* Strong understanding of security best practices for cloud and Kubernetes environments.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Preferred Qualifications Certifications.

title: Account Manager IT
description:
Vi på InfraCom söker en Account Manager som vill ta nästa steg i karriären i ett framgångsrikt IT-bolag.
   

  

 Som säljare på InfraCom har du en betydelsefull roll då du är vår viktigaste länk mellan bolaget och våra 30 000 kunder. Med våra egenutvecklade tjänster skapar vi kundnytta med hög lönsamhet. Du kommer ha goda möjligheter vad gäller både förmåner, resor och mycket mer.
   

  

**Krav**
* Tydlig säljprofil med flera års arbetslivserfarenhet av försäljning inom IT, B2B
* Försäljningserfarenhet av Microsoft tjänster
* Försäljningserfarenhet av SAAS tjänster
* Du ska ha ett utvecklat affärssinne och en professionell framtoning som inger och skapar förtroende
* Du är en lagspelare som samtidigt förstår vikten av att ditt personliga driv bidrar till helheten
* Flytande språkkunskap i svenska och engelska
* B-körkort


**Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden**
* Bearbeta kunder och blivande kunder inom SMB segmentet
* Identifiera affärsmöjligheter och driva IT-försäljning som bidrar till företagets tillväxt och framgång
* Vidareutveckla samarbeten, skapa fler möjligheter, affärer och relationer
* Boka möten, följa upp, bearbeta, skriva offerter samt stänga affärer och arbeta med kundvård
* Aktivt arbete med bolagets CRM system


**Vi erbjuder**
* En nyckelroll i ett börsnoterat IT-bolag i stark tillväxt.
* Möjlighet att sätta din prägel på en ny försäljningskultur.
* Förmåner som tjänstebil, tävlingar och resor.
* Tjänstepension och möjlighet till löneväxling.
* En företagskultur där laget går före jaget och där vi värnar om våra medarbetare.


**Om InfraCom Group AB**
 InfraCom Group AB (publ) är en ledande aktör inom IT-infrastruktur. Sedan 1999 erbjuder vi tjänster inom mobil- och fasttelefoni, molnväxel, internet via fiber, server, hosting och webbplattformar. Vi har mer än 30 000 kunder, främst inom SME-segmentet samt offentlig förvaltning.
   

  

* Omsättning: ca 800 miljoner
* Ca 300 medarbetare
* + 20 kontor
* Certifierade enligt ISO9001, ISO14001 och ISO27001
* Anslutna till kollektivavtal


**Arbetsort:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Anställningsform:** 
 Heltid, tillsvidare, provanställning tillämpas
   

  

**Start:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**
 Urval och intervjuer sker löpande vilket innebär att tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Har du frågor kring rollen eller din ansökan vänligen kontakta försäljningschef i Stockholm Stefan Ohlander (stefan.ohlander@infracom.se).

title: Elnätsingenjör
description:
Cleeven är en konsultgrupp inom Engineering, R&D och IT som stöttar kunder i deras utvecklingsarbete och operativa excellens. Vi specialiserar oss på innovation och avancerad ingenjörskonst i flera sektorer, inklusive energi, flyg & försvar, transport, läkemedel & kemi samt IT & telekom.
 



  





 Vi söker nu
 **Elnätsplanerare** 
 med expertis inom
 **nätstationer** 
 och
 **nätplanering** 
 . I rollen ansvarar du för planering, utveckling och integrering av elnätslösningar från lågspänning till högspänning, med särskilt fokus på stationer, fördelningsnät och kapacitetsförstärkningar. Du arbetar nära multidisciplinära team för att ta fram robusta planer, tekniska underlag och investeringsförslag som möter standarder, regulatoriska krav och kundernas behov.
 



  





 Dina ansvarsområden:
 



  




* Planera och dimensionera elnät (MV/LV) med fokus på nätstationer, kabel- och ledningsnät samt framtida kapacitetsbehov.
* Genomföra belastningsflöden, kortslutningsberäkningar; ta fram åtgärds- och investeringsplaner.
* Utföra anslutnings- och förstärkningsutredningar för ny- och ombyggnation.
* Ta fram systemskisser, stationslayouter, enlinjescheman samt selektivitets- och skyddsfilosofi i samverkan med stations- och skyddsingenjörer.
* Arbeta med tillstånds- och samrådsunderlag (MKB-stöd), kalkyler, risk- och konsekvensanalyser samt teknisk dokumentation.
* Samverka med projektledare, entreprenörer, myndigheter och markägare; bidra i upphandlingar och tekniska specifikationer.
* Följa upp genomförda åtgärder, verifiera mot plan och stödja driftsättning samt erfarenhetsåterföring.



  





 Kvalifikationer
 



  




* Civil- eller högskoleingenjör inom elkraft/elektroteknik eller motsvarande.
* Erfarenhet av elnätsplanering och/eller stationsprojekt, inklusive dimensionering och layout av nätstationer.
* Vana av beräknings- och planeringsverktyg såsom Digpro (DpPower)
 
 & CAD
 **.**
* God kännedom om låg- och mellanspänningsnät, skydds- och selektivitetsprinciper, jordnings- och kortslutningskrav samt driftsäkerhet. Erfarenhet inom högspänning är ett stort plus.
* Meriterande: erfarenhet av anslutningsutredningar för förnybart och laddning, investeringskalkyler/asset management, samt kunskap om svenska regelverk (t.ex. Ei).
* Analytisk, strukturerad och lösningsorienterad med förmåga att arbeta tvärfunktionellt och hantera flera uppdrag parallellt.
* God svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.



  





 Känner du att det passar dig? Tveka inte att söka idag då urval sker löpande.

title: Senior Operations Engineer VMware
description:

 Vi söker en erfaren

 för ett konsultuppdrag i en samhällsviktig och säkerhetsfokuserad verksamhet.  Solna eller Forsmark (onsite)

 2026-01-12

 2026-06-30

 Heltid (40 timmar/vecka)

* IT-säkerhet och compliance
* Erfarenhet av automatiseringsverktyg: Ansible, SaltStack, PowerShell, VBScript

* Förmåga att hantera incidenter och arbeta strukturerat i komplexa miljöer
* God kommunikationsförmåga och samarbetsförmåga
